entries.meaning: (aviation) A lighter-than-air aircraft that can be propelled forward through the air as well as steered.
examples: 'Airships are posited to be cheaper to operate over time than fixed-wing aircraft, but as there are no large fleets, this is hard to prove in practice.

entries.meaning: (US, law enforcement, aviation) A police air unit, a police helicopter

examples: On weekends, I liked to spend my time at the airport watching the various airships take off and land.

entries.meaning: (Britain, derogatory, chiefly in the plural) A high ranking official of the RAF, viewed as arrogant and distant.

verbs.description: airship (third-person singular simple present airships, present participle airshipping, simple past and past participle airshipped)
